instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: Macbook 2015 slowed
threads.message:
Sorry about the confusing title.

Mid 2012 Macbook Pro Retina 15", 8 gig ram, i7 2.3 GHz

In OS the fans run full speed all the time and programs, etc. run slow. The same machine, using Boot Camp, has Windows installed. In Windows the fans run full speed, but programs, etc. run normally.

Could this be kernal panic caused by the crappy tantalum caps in the buffer circuit?

Thanks

threads.title: Macbook 2015 slowed
threads.message: Sensor issue.... You need to run asd to find which sensor is misreporting, But if it doesn't have liquid damage I'll be willing to bet that it's trackpad.

threads.title: Macbook 2015 slowed
threads.message: This isn't kernel panic and it isn't bad caps...

threads.title: Macbook 2015 slowed
threads.message: Run ASD and check for sensor issues.

threads.title: Macbook 2015 slowed
threads.message:
Thanks guys!
I'll do that when I get home from my other job and locate a copy of the software!

threads.title: Macbook 2015 slowed
threads.message:
[QUOTE="esmannr, post: 20295"]Sorry about the confusing title.

In OS the fans run full speed all the time and programs, etc. run slow. The same machine, using Boot Camp, has Windows installed. In Windows the fans run full speed, but programs, etc. run normally.

Thanks[/QUOTE]

ASD thread:

[URL="https://www.rossmanngroup.com/boards/forum/tools/2150-asd-apple-system-diagnostics/page2"]https://www.rossmanngroup.com/boards...gnostics/page2[/URL]


High fan speed, slow OS... Test with new T-Pad and cable. Just plug new in, no need to fit it just for testing.

threads.title: Macbook 2015 slowed
threads.message:
Thermal Interface - Processor ... TIM Test 75 percent GB (test #4)
ERROR -- 255

AirPort (test #41) - Wake on Wireless...
ERROR -- 20 [WakeOnWireless test failed, invalid wake event]

Everything else passed.

No T-pad and cable on hand... ordering one.

threads.title: Macbook 2015 slowed
threads.message: Run the EFI version of ASD. If there are no errors no sense in replacing a trackpad.

threads.title: Macbook 2015 slowed
threads.message: Ran EFI four times. No errors.

threads.title: Macbook 2015 slowed
threads.message: Not possible. If the fan is running on full there must at least be a fan error.

threads.title: Macbook 2015 slowed
threads.message: When the EFI fan test was going, the fans adjusted speeds. When the test was done, the fans went to full speed again. Ran the test once and then a tree cycle loop, no errors.

threads.title: Macbook 2015 slowed
threads.message: well if its not giving any errors there probably is a good chance there is non. did you check to see how hot the cpu and gpu are getting? maybe its getting hot and "needs" the fan at full.  the other thing to consider testing is a different hard drive with osx to confirm the osx and drive are good.  also in your first post you thought it might have been a kernel panic, Did you actually experience a kernel panic?

threads.title: Macbook 2015 slowed
threads.message: Did you do a PRAM reset? In ASD you can click the hardware profile and see all readings of the sensors. Are there any temp sensors that are reading high?

threads.title: Macbook 2015 slowed
threads.message:
to dukefawks - reset PRAM. No joy.  Will look in ASD.
to nate8organic - Just working real slow and fans running full speed.

The case is cool in OS and Windows.

threads.title: Macbook 2015 slowed
threads.message: I really have no idea. Check the hardware profile in ASD and note all the actual readings of the temp sensors.
